description.highlights: The Metropolitan Museum of Art is one of the largest and most visited art museums in the world, with a diverse and extensive collection.
description.shape: The main building is a large, sprawling complex with an architectural design that has expanded over time.
description.spatial design: The museum's spatial design allows for the display of a vast array of art and artifacts, with specialized galleries for different time periods and cultures.
description.material design: The museum features notable interiors and uses a range of materials to display and preserve its collection, including the construction of its galleries and exhibition spaces.
description.keywords: art museum, large collection, diverse exhibits, historic interiors, encyclopedic collections

birdview.highlights: The highlight of this design is its complex layout with multiple wings and courtyards, suggesting a mix of different architectural styles and time periods.
birdview.shape: The form is asymmetrical, with a mix of rectangular and polygonal shapes. The most notable is the hexagonal glass structure.
birdview.spatial design: The highlight of its shape and form is the combination of strict geometrical shapes that accommodate different functions and the open spaces that integrate with the built environment.
birdview.material design: Diverse roofing materials can be seen, with glass structures that probably allow natural light into the spaces below and flat roofing possibly used for utilitarian purposes.
birdview.keywords: Asymmetrical, Complex, Mixed-styles, Courtyards, Glass Roof, Geometrical Shape, Diverse Materials

floorplan.highlights: The layout organizes various thematic and historical exhibits in an accessible and logical manner, creating an educational journey through art history.
floorplan.shape: The museum plan is asymmetrical but functional, with wings and galleries organized around central spaces like The Great Hall.
floorplan.spatial design: The central positioning of The Great Hall acts as a hub, emphasizing accessibility and orientation within the museum.
floorplan.material design: While the map does not specify materials, the spatial design suggests a combination of open spaces for movement and enclosed galleries for art display.
floorplan.keywords: Educational, Historical Exhibits, Asymmetrical, Functional, Central Hub, Accessibility, Enclosed Galleries

interior.highlights: The grand arches and the sweeping vaulted ceilings
interior.shape: Classic arched and domed design with a symmetrical layout
interior.spatial design: Generous use of space accentuated by grand arches and high ceilings, creating an expansive and open atmosphere
interior.material design: Elegant use of stone and marble with intricate detailing on the ceilings and walls
interior.keywords: Arches, Vaults, Symmetry, Elegance, Open Space, Stone, Marble, Intricate Detailing
